metadata.Title: CVE-2023-41983 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.1, Safari 17.1, iOS 16.7.2 and iPadOS 16.7.2, iOS 17.1 and iPadOS 17.1. Processing web content may lead to a denial-of-service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-41983` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8 mdeslaur> It is no longer possible to build new webkit2gtk versions on focal and earlier. Marking as ignored.

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1').
